availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives

body.p: Requisition for Ordnance Stores and Camp Equipage, &c., for the use of Company Silver Creek Rangers of the Regiment of Cavalry --, which was mustered into the KENTUCKY STATE GUARD on the 17th day of June, 1861, at , in Madison county.

6 pdr. brass cannon. 6 pdr. carriages. Muskets, complete. Rifles, complete. Cartridge boxes. Cartridge box belts. Bayonet seabbards. Waist belt-plates. Gun slings. Sabres Sabre belts & plate Cavalry Pistols & Carbines
Fifty 44 Fifty 44 Fifty 88 Fifty 44.
Total
50 50 50 50
REMARKS.

Requisitions for arms should never be for a number greatly in excess of the actual strength of the Company, and should be addressed to the Inspector General at Louisville, who will transmit them to the Adjutant General at Frankfort, who will submit them to the Governor for approval or modification. When the issues do not fully cover the requisition, the receipt will be altered by the Adjutant General to correspond with the issues, and the Company commander be notified thereof.
I CERTIFY that there are 44 active, bona fide members of the above mentioned Company, exclusive of commissioned officers.

Durrett M White
Captain
Commanding Company.

Date: June
17, 1861
Received, day of , 186, of , Quartermaster General, the following named articles:
60 44 75 Muskets, complete. Sabers
44 75 Rifles, complete. Carbines 44 Carbines
150 88 150 Cartridge boxes. Pistols with accoutrements
Cartridge box belts.
Bayonet scabbards.
Waist belt-plates.
7560 Gun slings.
I hereby certify that the within requistion for ordnance and ordnance stores and camp equipage, &c., is made with my consent.

James H. Embry
County Judge of Madison County. Ky
The Quartermaster General is hereby directed to make the issue of public stores and arms in accordance with this requisition.

B. Magoffin
Pres of the Board
Governor and Commander-in-Chief

with (525)
REQUISITION
For ordnance, &c., for company of Regiment, K. S. G. Issued , 186, and charged to county.

Head Quarters Ky State Guard
Louisville 5 July 1861
The within requisition is approved and it is recommended that Fifty of each of the within articles be issued hereunder

By Command of
Maj. Gen S B Buckner
Inspt Gen.

Official
Alex Casseday
Asst. Adjt. Gen.
